abstract: Marine corporal Wassef Ali Hassoun, charged with faking his abduction in Iraq in 2004 and evading punishment for years by fleeing to Lebanon, is found guilty of two counts of desertion; is dishonorably discharged and sentenced to two years in prison.
lead_paragraph: Corporal Wassef Ali Hassoun, a naturalized United States citizen, vanished twice, first while serving in Iraq, and later fleeing to Lebanon, his native country.

headline.main: A Marine Is Convicted on Two Counts of Desertion
headline.print_headline: A Marine Is Convicted on 2 Counts of Desertion

snippet: Corporal Wassef Ali Hassoun, a naturalized United States citizen, vanished twice, first while serving in Iraq, and later fleeing to Lebanon, his native country.
